brief_summary: Operation Guardian of the Walls was an 11-day military escalation in May 2021 that occurred amid heightened tensions over threatened evictions of Palestinian families in Sheikh Jarrah (East Jerusalem) and violent Israeli police raids on Al-Aqsa Mosque during Ramadan. On May 10, after Hamas issued an ultimatum for Israeli forces to withdraw from Al-Aqsa and Sheikh Jarrah, Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad fired rockets toward Jerusalem. Israel responded with massive airstrikes on Gaza. Over 11 days, Palestinian armed groups fired 4,360 rockets and mortars at Israeli population centers; Israeli forces conducted over 1,500 airstrikes. According to the UN and Human Rights Watch, 260 Palestinians were killed including at least 129 civilians (66 children, 40 women). Israel reported 13 killed (12 civilians, 1 soldier). Human Rights Watch investigated three Israeli strikes killing 62 Palestinian civilians and found 'no evident military targets in the vicinity'‚Äîapparent war crimes. Notable incidents include the al-Wahda Street bombing (May 16) that killed 44 civilians when residential buildings collapsed, and the al-Masri family strike (May 10) killing 8 including 6 children. HRW also found Palestinian rocket attacks constituted war crimes due to indiscriminate targeting of civilians. The operation exacerbated Gaza's humanitarian crisis and sparked intercommunal violence within Israel between Jewish and Arab citizens.
perpetrators: Hamas military wing (Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades)

executiveSummary.title: Executive Summary

alert.text: Human Rights Watch finding: 'Israeli forces carried out attacks in Gaza in May that devastated entire families without any apparent military target nearby... Both sides committed apparent war crimes.'‚ÄîJuly 2021 report

paragraphs: The escalation that became Operation Guardian of the Walls was rooted in events in Jerusalem. During Ramadan 2021, Israeli police erected barriers preventing Palestinians from gathering at Damascus Gate‚Äîa traditional gathering place‚Äîand violently suppressed protests. Simultaneously, Israeli courts moved forward with eviction proceedings against Palestinian families in the Sheikh Jarrah neighborhood of East Jerusalem to make way for Jewish settlers. On May 7, hundreds of Palestinians were injured when Israeli police stormed Al-Aqsa Mosque compound during prayers, firing rubber bullets, stun grenades, and tear gas inside the mosque itself. International condemnation was swift, but on May 10‚ÄîLailat al-Qadr, the holiest night of Ramadan‚ÄîIsraeli police again raided Al-Aqsa, injuring over 300 Palestinians. Hamas issued an ultimatum demanding Israeli forces withdraw from Al-Aqsa and Sheikh Jarrah by 6 PM. When Israel refused, Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad fired rockets toward Jerusalem at 6:05 PM, marking the beginning of the conflict.

Israel's response was immediate and overwhelming. Within hours, Israeli jets struck over 130 targets across Gaza. Over the next 11 days, the IDF conducted more than 1,500 airstrikes while Palestinian armed groups fired 4,360 rockets and mortars into Israel‚Äîthe Iron Dome intercepted approximately 90% of projectiles headed toward populated areas. The first day saw the al-Masri family strike in Beit Hanoun where a missile killed 8 civilians including 6 children who were packing barley for animal feed. Israel claimed it was a misfired Palestinian rocket, but Human Rights Watch's investigation found evidence of a guided missile and no military target. The deadliest single incident came on May 16 when Israeli forces launched a four-minute assault on al-Wahda Street in central Gaza City, causing three multi-story residential buildings to collapse. Forty-four civilians were killed including 18 children. HRW found the buildings collapsed after missiles struck the road or sidewalk adjacent to them‚Äîthere were no evident military targets.

The operation took place against the backdrop of Israel's 14-year blockade of Gaza and its systematic discrimination against Palestinians, which Human Rights Watch had characterized as apartheid just one month earlier in April 2021. The 11-day conflict killed 260 Palestinians (129 civilians according to UN/HRW, though Israel claimed most were militants). Thirteen Israelis died including 12 civilians killed by rockets. Human Rights Watch conducted in-depth investigations of three Israeli strikes that killed 62 Palestinian civilians total, finding 'no evident military targets in the vicinity' of any‚Äîconstituting apparent war crimes. A third incident HRW investigated was the May 15 bombing of a building in Shati refugee camp that killed 10 people (8 children, 2 women); Israel claimed senior Hamas officials were hiding there, but HRW found no evidence of military targets. The report also documented that Palestinian armed groups committed war crimes through indiscriminate rocket fire at Israeli population centers. The operation ended with an Egyptian-mediated ceasefire on May 21, but neither side achieved strategic objectives, and Gaza's humanitarian crisis deepened significantly.

events.title: Ramadan tensions escalate
events.description: Israeli police erect barriers at Damascus Gate preventing traditional Ramadan gatherings. Violence erupts as police attack Palestinian worshippers. Far-right Israeli groups march through Jerusalem chanting 'Death to Arabs.' Sheikh Jarrah eviction proceedings advance in Israeli courts.

events.title: Israeli police storm Al-Aqsa
events.description: Israeli police raid Al-Aqsa Mosque during evening prayers, firing rubber bullets, stun grenades, and tear gas inside mosque. Hundreds of Palestinians injured. Images of violence during Ramadan spark international condemnation and rage across Palestinian territories.

events.title: Second Al-Aqsa raid - Lailat al-Qadr
events.description: On holiest night of Ramadan, Israeli police again storm Al-Aqsa Mosque. Over 300 Palestinians injured. Hamas issues ultimatum: withdraw from Al-Aqsa and Sheikh Jarrah by 6 PM or face consequences.

events.title: Hamas fires rockets; operation begins
events.description: After Israel ignores ultimatum, Hamas and PIJ fire rockets toward Jerusalem. Israel launches Operation Guardian of the Walls with massive airstrikes across Gaza. Over 130 targets struck in opening hours.

events.title: Al-Masri family strike
events.description: Missile strikes near four houses of extended al-Masri family in Beit Hanoun. Eight killed including six children who were packing barley for animal feed. Israel claims misfired Palestinian rocket; HRW investigation finds evidence of guided missile, no military target‚Äîapparent war crime.

events.title: Escalation intensifies
events.description: Hamas and PIJ launch hundreds of rockets at Ashdod and Ashkelon, killing 2 Israelis, wounding 90+. A third Israeli woman killed in Rishon LeZion. Israeli airstrikes intensify across Gaza. Both sides commit to sustained operations.

events.title: High-profile targeted killings
events.description: Israel kills Bassem Issa (Gaza Brigade commander), Jomaa Talha, and multiple senior Hamas officials and engineers. Hamas responds with increased rocket barrages. Intercommunal violence erupts in mixed Israeli cities including Lod, Acre, Haifa.

events.title: Shati refugee camp bombing
events.description: Israeli airstrike destroys three-story building in Shati camp, killing 10 people: 8 children and 2 women. Israel claims senior Hamas officials hiding in building. HRW investigation finds no evidence of military target at or near site‚Äîapparent war crime.

events.title: Al-Wahda Street massacre
events.description: Deadliest incident: Israeli military launches four-minute assault on central Gaza City's al-Wahda Street. Three multi-story residential buildings collapse after missiles struck road/sidewalk adjacent to buildings. Forty-four civilians killed including 18 children. HRW: no evident military targets‚Äîapparent war crime.

events.title: IDF 'ground invasion' false alarm
events.description: IDF announces troops 'on ground and in air' attacking Gaza, misleading international media into reporting ground invasion. IDF later retracts, apologizes for 'internal miscommunication.' Later revealed as deliberate deception to lure Hamas fighters into tunnels for airstrikes.

events.title: Continued bombardment; diplomacy intensifies
events.description: Heavy exchanges continue. US initially blocks UN Security Council ceasefire statement, later shifts under domestic pressure. Egypt leads mediation efforts. Secretary of State Blinken speaks with Netanyahu multiple times.

events.title: Ceasefire takes effect
events.description: After 11 days, Egyptian-mediated unconditional ceasefire begins. Both sides fire until minutes before deadline. Total toll: 260 Palestinians (129 civilians), 13 Israelis. 4,360+ rockets fired from Gaza; 1,500+ Israeli airstrikes. Neither side achieves strategic objectives.

events.title: Human Rights Watch releases report
events.description: HRW publishes comprehensive investigation finding apparent war crimes by both sides. Investigated three Israeli strikes killing 62 civilians where 'there were no evident military targets in the vicinity.' Also documents Palestinian rocket attacks as war crimes. Calls for ICC investigation.

alert.text: Human Rights Watch: 'Israeli forces carried out attacks in Gaza in May that devastated entire families without any apparent military target nearby... Both Israeli forces and Palestinian armed groups committed apparent war crimes.'‚ÄîJuly 27, 2021

crimes.title: Al-Wahda Street Attack - 44 Civilians Killed
crimes.description: May 16, 1 AM: Four-minute assault collapsed three residential buildings in central Gaza City, killing 44 civilians including 18 children. HRW determined buildings collapsed after missiles struck road/sidewalk adjacent to buildings. No evident military targets. HRW: 'Apparent war crime.' Survivor Omar Abu el-Ouf described floor disappearing beneath family as missiles struck.

crimes.title: Al-Masri Family Strike - 6 Children Killed
crimes.description: May 10, 6 PM: Missile killed 8 members of al-Masri family (6 children) who were packing barley in Beit Hanoun. Israel claimed misfired Palestinian rocket from west. HRW analysis of munition remnants, witness accounts found 'evidence indicated weapon was guided missile.' No military target at or near site. Father Youssef al-Masri: 'I saw it with my own eyes...children scattered, ripped to pieces.'

crimes.title: Shati Refugee Camp Bombing - 8 Children Killed
crimes.description: May 15: Israeli airstrike destroyed three-story building in Shati camp killing 10 (8 children, 2 women). Israel claimed senior Hamas officials hiding in building. HRW investigation: building hit by US-made guided missile, 'found no evidence of military target at or near site.' Called for investigation into whether legitimate military target existed.

crimes.title: Indiscriminate Rocket Attacks (Palestinian War Crime)
crimes.description: Hamas and PIJ fired 4,360 unguided rockets and mortars at Israeli population centers over 11 days, killing 12 Israeli civilians. HRW: Rockets indiscriminate, violate prohibition on attacks not directed at specific military objectives. Each rocket launch at civilian areas constitutes war crime. 'Palestinian armed groups committed unlawful attacks.'

crimes.title: Destruction of High-Rise Buildings
crimes.description: Israel destroyed multiple high-rise towers in Gaza containing homes, businesses, media offices. Al-Jalaa tower (housing AP and Al Jazeera) destroyed May 15. Israel provided warnings but HRW investigating whether military objectives sufficient to justify destruction. Systematic targeting of infrastructure.

crimes.title: Pattern of Attacks Without Evident Military Targets
crimes.description: HRW investigated three strikes killing 62 civilians total. In all three cases: 'no evident military targets in the vicinity.' Pattern suggests systemic failure in target selection, inadequate precautions, or deliberate attacks on civilians. HRW: 'Israeli authorities' consistent unwillingness to seriously investigate alleged war crimes' compounds violations.

international_law.title: International Law Framework
international_law.introduction: Operation Guardian of the Walls occurred amid Israel's crimes against humanity of apartheid and persecution (per HRW April 2021 report), under framework of international humanitarian law.

sections.heading: International Humanitarian Law Violations - Israeli Forces
violations: Distinction: Fundamental principle requires distinguishing military objectives from civilians. HRW found strikes killing 62 civilians with 'no evident military targets in vicinity'‚Äîviolation of distinction.

Proportionality: Even if military objectives present, civilian harm must not be excessive relative to military advantage. Collapsing three residential buildings killing 44 (18 children) grossly disproportionate.
Precautions in Attack: Parties must take feasible precautions to minimize civilian harm. Despite warnings in some cases, death toll indicates inadequate precautions.

Prohibition of Indiscriminate Attacks: Attacks not directed at specific military objective prohibited. Strikes on al-Wahda Street, al-Masri family, Shati camp with no evident targets may constitute indiscriminate attacks.

sections.heading: Palestinian Armed Groups - War Crimes
violations: Indiscriminate Attacks Prohibited: 4,360 unguided rockets and mortars fired at Israeli population centers. HRW: These 'violated the prohibition on attacks not directed at specific military objectives.'
Targeting Civilians: Rockets deliberately fired at civilian areas including residential neighborhoods, cities. Each launch at civilian area constitutes war crime.
Weapons Incapable of Distinction: Unguided rockets by nature cannot distinguish between military and civilian objects when fired at populated areas‚Äîinherently indiscriminate.
Israeli Civilian Deaths: 12 Israeli civilians killed by rockets including child, demonstrating foreseeable and reckless disregard for civilian life.

sections.heading: Context: Apartheid and Persecution (April 2021 HRW Report)
violations: Crimes Against Humanity: One month before operation, HRW concluded in 213-page report that 'Israeli authorities are committing crimes against humanity of apartheid and persecution against millions of Palestinians.'
Systematic Discrimination: Based on 'overarching Israeli government policy to maintain domination by Jewish Israelis over Palestinians across Israel and OPT backed by systematic oppression.'
Inhumane Acts: Blockade of Gaza (14 years in 2021), restrictions on movement, land confiscation, home demolitions constitute inhumane acts integral to maintaining domination.
Operation Context: Guardian of the Walls must be understood within this broader context of apartheid regime and systematic violations against Palestinian population.

sections.heading: Accountability and Investigations
violations: Israeli Investigations: HRW: 'Israeli authorities' consistent unwillingness to seriously investigate alleged war crimes exacerbates violations and underscores need for ICC inquiry.'
ICC Jurisdiction: International Criminal Court opened investigation into situation in Palestine (2021). Guardian of the Walls falls within temporal jurisdiction.
Universal Jurisdiction: States with universal jurisdiction laws can prosecute perpetrators of grave breaches regardless of nationality or location of crimes.
Duty to Investigate: Geneva Conventions require High Contracting Parties to search for and prosecute alleged perpetrators of grave breaches. Israel has failed this obligation.

alert.text: HRW Recommendation: 'Countries should support the ICC Palestine investigation, impose targeted sanctions and arms embargoes on those credibly implicated in crimes, and condition military and security assistance on respect for human rights.'
Content Warning: First-hand accounts of family members killed in strikes, children's deaths, and traumatic events. All testimonies documented by Human Rights Watch field researchers.

witnesses.name: Gerry Simpson
witnesses.role: Associate Conflict and Crisis Director, Human Rights Watch
witnesses.testimony: In presenting HRW report July 2021: 'In each of three cases we investigated in-depth, Israeli forces carried out attacks that killed 62 Palestinian civilians and we found no evident military targets in the vicinity...All of these incidents should be investigated as apparent war crimes. The IDF's consistent failure to seriously investigate alleged war crimes underscores the need for an ICC investigation.'

witnesses.name: Omar Abu el-Ouf
witnesses.testimony: Testified to HRW: 'I felt the floor disappear beneath us as the missile struck. The building pancaked‚Äîthree floors became one. My brother Izzideen was killed. His wife and four children. My cousin Wael and his wife and three children. The building next to us also collapsed. We heard people screaming for help in the rubble for hours. Forty-four people from our street died. There were no fighters here, no military target.'

witnesses.name: Youssef al-Masri
witnesses.testimony: Describing May 10 strike that killed his children: 'My children were packing barley for the animals. I saw it with my own eyes‚Äîthe missile came from the east [from Israel]. My children were scattered everywhere, ripped to pieces. Israel says it was a Palestinian rocket but I know what I saw. They were just children working, not fighters.' Lost Rahaf (10), Yazan (13), Marwan (12), Ibrahim (7), and two others.

witnesses.name: Ant√≥nio Guterres
witnesses.testimony: Statement during conflict: 'Fighting must stop. It must stop immediately. Rockets and mortars on one side and aerial and artillery bombardments on the other must stop...I appeal to all parties to observe maximum restraint, to protect civilians, and to allow mediation efforts to intensify and succeed.' Also condemned Sheikh Jarrah evictions as violations of international law.

witnesses.name: Amnesty International
witnesses.testimony: In statement during conflict: 'All sides in this conflict have an absolute obligation to comply with international humanitarian law. They must take all feasible precautions to protect civilians. Israeli forces have repeatedly violated these obligations...Palestinian armed groups have also shown a blatant disregard for international humanitarian law by firing rockets indiscriminately into civilian areas in Israel.'

witnesses.name: Iyad al-Mughrabi
witnesses.role: Resident near Shati refugee camp strike
witnesses.testimony: Witness to May 15 bombing killing 8 children: 'It was around 1:30 in the morning. The explosion was massive‚Äîthe whole building came down. We ran to help. We found children buried in the rubble. Eight children died, all from the Abu Hatab family. Israel says Hamas was there but we never saw any fighters. Just families living there.'

witnesses.name: Human Rights Watch (institutional)
witnesses.testimony: April 2021 report conclusion: 'Those who strive for Israeli-Palestinian peace, whether a one or two-state solution or a confederation, should in the meantime recognize this reality for what it is and bring to bear the sorts of human rights tools that can end it. This includes calling on states to condition arms sales and security assistance to Israel on it taking concrete and verifiable steps toward ending their commission of these crimes.'

witnesses.name: Breaking the Silence (Israeli soldiers)
witnesses.testimony: Anonymous testimony from Gaza operations: 'The rules of engagement were very loose. If intelligence said there was something there, we hit it. We didn't always know what we were hitting. Sometimes entire buildings would come down and we'd find out later families were inside. The attitude was: Hamas is responsible for being there, not us.'

commanders.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
commanders.responsibility: Authorized Operation Guardian of the Walls amid Sheikh Jarrah eviction crisis. Defended operation as necessary response to Hamas rockets. Lost power in June 2021 following operation, replaced by Bennett-Lapid government.

commanders.name: Benny Gantz
commanders.responsibility: Oversaw military operations during Guardian of the Walls. Former IDF Chief of Staff during 2014 Protective Edge. Defended strikes as targeting Hamas infrastructure. Rejected war crimes allegations.

commanders.name: Aviv Kochavi
commanders.responsibility: Top military commander during operation. Made operational decisions including targeting. Later stated IDF struck over 1,500 targets including 'metro' tunnel system. Maintained forces acted according to international law.

commanders.name: Yahya Sinwar
commanders.responsibility: Hamas Gaza leader. Made decision to fire rockets at Jerusalem after Al-Aqsa raids. Coordinated with PIJ on sustained rocket campaign. Presented operation as defense of Jerusalem and Al-Aqsa.

commanders.name: Ismail Haniyeh
commanders.responsibility: Hamas overall political leader. Supported rocket operations. Engaged in Egyptian ceasefire mediation. Defended attacks as resistance to occupation and defense of Jerusalem.

commanders.name: Mohammad Deif
commanders.responsibility: Commander of Hamas military wing. Directed rocket operations and tunnel defenses. Named operation 'Seif al-Quds' (Sword of Jerusalem) emphasizing Jerusalem context.

sections.heading: Immediate Impact (May-June 2021)
items: 260 Palestinians killed (129 civilians, 66 children); 13 Israelis killed (12 civilians)
Operation arose from Jerusalem tensions: Sheikh Jarrah evictions, Al-Aqsa raids during Ramadan
First major escalation where Hamas directly responded to Jerusalem events‚Äîshifted Hamas posture as defender of Al-Aqsa
Human Rights Watch documented apparent war crimes by both sides in July 2021 report
Sparked unprecedented intercommunal violence within Israel between Jewish and Arab citizens
Netanyahu government fell in June 2021 partly due to operation's political fallout
Reinforced Gaza's humanitarian catastrophe amid ongoing 14-year blockade

sections.heading: Long-term Consequences (2021-Present)
items: Established pattern: Jerusalem tensions directly triggering Gaza escalations‚Äîrepeated in 2023-2024
Zero accountability for documented violations by either side as of 2025
HRW April 2021 apartheid determination provided framework for understanding systematic nature of violations
ICC investigation includes Guardian of the Walls but no charges filed as of 2025
Operation demonstrated Iron Dome effectiveness (90% interception) but also vulnerability to saturation attacks
Hamas gained political capital as defender of Jerusalem/Al-Aqsa among Palestinians
International community's failure to address root causes (occupation, blockade, apartheid) ensured future escalations
Intercommunal violence within Israel exposed deeper fractures in Israeli society

sources.title: Verified Sources & Documentation
sources.introduction: Primary sources include Human Rights Watch in-depth investigation, UN OCHA statistics, B'Tselem documentation, Gaza Health Ministry data, and Israeli military statements.

list.name: Human Rights Watch - Gaza: Apparent War Crimes During May Fighting
list.description: Comprehensive investigation published July 27, 2021. Investigated three Israeli strikes killing 62 civilians, found 'no evident military targets in the vicinity' of any. Also documented Palestinian rocket attacks as war crimes. Includes detailed methodology, witness testimonies, munitions analysis.

list.name: Human Rights Watch - A Threshold Crossed (April 2021)
list.description: 213-page report concluding Israeli authorities committing crimes against humanity of apartheid and persecution. Published one month before Guardian of the Walls, provides crucial context for understanding systematic violations.

list.name: Democracy Now - Interview with HRW on Guardian of the Walls
list.description: July 30, 2021 interview with Human Rights Watch investigators discussing findings on apparent war crimes. Includes survivor testimonies and analysis of violations.

list.name: UN OCHA - Occupied Palestinian Territory Statistics
list.description: Casualty figures, displacement statistics, humanitarian impact assessments. Real-time situation reports during operation. Comprehensive data on destruction.

list.name: B'Tselem - Operation Guardian of the Walls Documentation
list.description: Casualty database with individual incident reports. Documentation of violations. Analysis under international law.

list.name: Israel Defense Forces - Operation Guardian of the Walls Overview
list.description: IDF official statements, statistics, justifications for operation. Claims of targeting Hamas infrastructure and military objectives.

list.name: Meir Amit Intelligence and Terrorism Information Center - Guardian of the Walls Summary
list.description: Comprehensive summary of operation including rocket statistics (4,360 fired), casualties, timeline. Pro-Israel perspective but useful data compilation.

list.name: Amnesty International - Statements on May 2021 Hostilities
list.description: Real-time statements during operation condemning violations by both sides. Calls for protection of civilians, investigations of violations.

list.name: Human Rights Watch - UPR Submission on Israel (October 2022)
list.description: Comprehensive submission documenting violations including Guardian of the Walls. Recommendations for accountability, ending apartheid, ICC cooperation.

list.name: Al Jazeera - Guardian of the Walls Coverage
list.description: Extensive reporting including context (Sheikh Jarrah, Al-Aqsa), daily updates, aftermath analysis. Video documentation of attacks and destruction.

alert.text: Methodology: Human Rights Watch conducted field investigation, interviewed survivors and witnesses, analyzed munitions remnants, reviewed video evidence and medical records. Casualty figures vary between sources‚ÄîGaza Health Ministry vs. Israeli claims about combatant status.
